N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 459.6 - Other requirements

State Regulations
(a) Record. Each provider of services shall
obtain and maintain a record of the following information for each individual
applying for and/or receiving services: (1)
name; (2)
social security
number; (3)
occupation (if
any); (4)
age; (5)
address; (6)
telephone number; (7)
spouse (if in home); (8)
minor children (if in home); (9)
identity and address of person to be
notified in case of emergency; and
(10)
date of registration. (b) Daily log. The senior citizen
center shall maintain a daily record of individuals receiving services. Such
daily log shall be centrally located so that participants can sign in each day
they attend. The date and signature of the participant will suffice for minimum
data requirements for this record. These logs shall be maintained by the senior
citizen center for post audit by the social services official. (c) Participant record, DSS-1875. Senior
citizen centers shall be required to complete and maintain a DSS-1875, participant record, or an equivalent approved by the State Department of Social

Services, for each participant in their program. Only one record for each
participant is needed. It will not be necessary to prepare these forms for all
enrollees, since a record can be completed as they participate. (d) Assurances. The social services official
shall obtain from a provider of services (P.O.S.), or submit to the department
as a provider of such services, written assurances on an annual basis that the
services provided meet the administrative and program requirements specified in
this Part. Notes
